title: On Union With God
creator: Blessed Albert The Great
description: LibriVox recording of On Union with God, by Blessed Albert the Great. Read by David Barnes. Surely the most deeply-rooted need of the human soul, its purest aspiration, is for the closest possible union with God. As one turns over the pages of this little work, written by Blessed Albert the Great towards the end of his life, when that great soul had ripened and matured, one feels that here indeed is the ideal of one's hopes. (From the Preface) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. M4B format available
subject: religion; philosophy
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
